column2: SELECT my.id, my.ra_s, my.dec_s, my.bmag, my.bvcolor, my.z_s, match.distance, u, g, r, i, z, dered_u, dered_g, dered_r, dered_i, dered_z --match.distance gives us the distance between the two sets of coordinates of objects (how od is your match) FROM MyDB.s2# as my CROSS APPLY dbo.fGetNearestObjID (my.ra_s, my.dec_s, #) as match--cross apply means only things that overlap will be kept: matching! --The dbo means database object --fGetNearestObjID (ra, dec, r) where u match on coordinates within a certain search radius. This function returns the ID JOIN PhotoPrimary as p --Excludes duplicates :) , aliased as p ON p.objid = match.objID
